segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 37
3. Balavagga
32. Ṭhānasutta
“Pañcimāni, bhikkhave, ṭhānāni dullabhāni akatapuññena mātugāmena.
segments.en: “Mendicants, there are five things that are hard to get for females who have not made merit.

segments.pli: Katamāni pañca?
Patirūpe kule jāyeyyanti—
segments.en: ‘May I be born into a suitable family!’

segments.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamaṃ ṭhānaṃ dullabhaṃ akatapuññena mātugāmena.
Patirūpe kule jāyitvā patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gaccheyyanti—
segments.en: ‘Having been born in a suitable family, may I marry into a suitable family!’

segments.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, dutiyaṃ ṭhānaṃ dullabhaṃ akatapuññena mātugāmena.
Patirūpe kule jāyitvā, patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gantvā, asapatti agāraṃ ajjhāvaseyyanti—
segments.en: ‘Having been born in a suitable family and married into a suitable family, may I live at home without a co-wife!’

segments.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyaṃ ṭhānaṃ dullabhaṃ akatapuññena mātugāmena.
Patirūpe kule jāyitvā, patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gantvā, asapatti agāraṃ ajjhāvasantī puttavatī assanti—
segments.en: ‘Having been born in a suitable family, and married into a suitable family, and living at home without a co-wife, may I have children!’

segments.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, catutthaṃ ṭhānaṃ dullabhaṃ akatapuññena mātugāmena.
Patirūpe kule jāyitvā, patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gantvā, asapatti agāraṃ ajjhāvasantī puttavatī samānā sāmikaṃ abhibhuyya vatteyyanti—
segments.en: ‘Having been born in a suitable family, and married into a suitable family, and living at home without a co-wife, and having had children, may I master my husband!’

segments.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamaṃ ṭhānaṃ dullabhaṃ akatapuññena mātugāmena.
Imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca ṭhānāni dullabhāni akatapuññena mātugāmenāti.
segments.en: These are the five things that are hard to get for females who have not made merit.

segments.pli: Pañcimāni, bhikkhave, ṭhānāni sulabhāni katapuññena mātugāmena.
segments.en: There are five things that are easy to get for females who have made merit.

segments.pli: Katamāni pañca?
Patirūpe kule jāyeyyanti—
segments.en: ‘May I be born into a suitable family!’

segments.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, paṭhamaṃ ṭhānaṃ sulabhaṃ katapuññena mātugāmena.

Patirūpe kule jāyitvā patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gantvā asapatti agāraṃ ajjhāvaseyyanti—
segments.en: ‘Having been born into a suitable family and married into a suitable family, may I live at home without a co-wife!’

segments.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, tatiyaṃ ṭhānaṃ sulabhaṃ katapuññena mātugāmena.
Patirūpe kule jāyitvā patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gantvā asapatti agāraṃ ajjhāvasantī puttavatī assanti—

segments.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, catutthaṃ ṭhānaṃ sulabhaṃ katapuññena mātugāmena.
Patirūpe kule jāyitvā patirūpaṃ kulaṃ gantvā asapatti agāraṃ ajjhāvasantī puttavatī samānā sāmikaṃ abhibhuyya vatteyyanti—
segments.en: ‘Having been born into a suitable family, and married into a suitable family, and living at home without a co-wife, and having had children, may I master my husband!’

segments.pli: idaṃ, bhikkhave, pañcamaṃ ṭhānaṃ sulabhaṃ katapuññena mātugāmena.
Imāni kho, bhikkhave, pañca ṭhānāni sulabhāni katapuññena mātugāmenā”ti.
segments.en: These are the five things that are easy to get for females who have made merit.”

segments.pli: Aṭṭhamaṃ.
